website_summaries.verdict: A well-made, versatile planter with a classic rustic appearance. Made from steel with a powder black finish for a cast iron look.
pros: Coco fiber liner drains well and is easily replaceable when it wears out
At 30 inches long, it fits plenty of plants
cons: Some users complain about the mounting hardware, but you can buy brackets separately if you don't like those included

customer_reviews.title: Use zipties to hold baskets
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the reviews that complain about the brackets. I had the same problem. The baskets are beautiful but the brackets are horrible. They did not fit my beautiful new Trex decking and Amazon did not respond to my concern. And there is no way to contact Panacea. That said, there was one comment on the reviews that was perfect. Get the zip ties to hold the baskets. I got the 48" baskets and used 4 ties per basket. you don't need the ugly brackets provided with the baskets.
customer_reviews.author: dggwood

customer_reviews.title: YES, you can mount on a wall
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to put up this review to show that you can mount these on a wall or directly to your house. Just dont use the included brackets. The brackets connect to the preexisting screw mounts in the back. I used a masonry bit and my lithium ion drill (not a hammer drill). Each hole took about 10 minutes of elbow grease. After that, I used tapcon screws, mounted the baskets and finished tightening. All in all, the boxes look great especially for the price. Fyi, mounting screws are NOT included so you'll need to buy them from a hardware store ($.35 each).
customer_reviews.author: History-Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Holding up well on my deck. Mounting brackets are very wide, made for wooden deck rail several inches wide. My rail is thin 1" metal so I used zip ties to attach, this works fine. The liner is holding up well (the liner material is sticky so watch your clothes when handling). The paint is flawless even after 2 months of salt air. It's plenty sturdy and looks great. The metal will bend if you push on it. I want a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Please Recycle

customer_reviews.title: Simple to assemble and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: These window planters are beautiful all set up. I purchased two of them. Right out of the box, they where very simple to assemble. I'm not that good with following instructions for assembling products but I didn't even need to look at the instructions to hang these up. They are light weight and easy for one person to move. All that needed to be assembled was adding on the brackets and tightening them onto the railing in the position that I liked. Like other reviewers mentioned, I secured the planter with a zip tie for safe measure. They hold plenty of soil/plants/flowers and they feel and look sturdy. I have received multiple compliments on these planters from friends and neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Product good, but brackets not as good.
customer_reviews.text: This planter is attractive and sturdy, and the liner fits perfectly. My problem is with the brackets. The ones I received only fit a rail at least 3 1/2 inches wide, while my metal balcony rail is 1 1/2 inches wide. I am unable to safely secure the planter. Since there were no specs on the mounting hardware, I assumed that it would include hardware for different kinds of rails (like other brands of rail-mounted planters I have purchased). The product listing would be improved by a description of mounting hardware or the size rails it will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Talkumi

customer_reviews.title: However it looks amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it a 5 if I didn't have to buy additional brackets to hang it under a window. However it looks amazing !
customer_reviews.author: LMC

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Construction
customer_reviews.text: This Item was discribed as flat iron when it is actually light gauge carbon steel metal stri spot welded to a light gage wire bottom frame. I order 4 of them based on the positive reviews. The very first one I took out of the box had a broken weld. The second one I opened was shipped in a inappropriately sized box that offered almost no protection to the item. It was protruding though the carton and was scratched in several places which will then rust if I chose to keep them which I will not. The bottom line is, it”s a fairly attractive planter but it is not “Flat Iron” and the construction is on the flimsy side.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Answer

customer_reviews.title: I love the look of these planters
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these planters, and they are so well constructed, BUT the hardware used to connect the planter to the railing really weren't described clearly. It would've been really helpful if there had been some photo or diagram of the hardware, as my railing is metal with glass connected to the metal, and about an inch longer than the bracket, the "L" of the bracket makes this impossible to use as a hanging planter. Sending back is too hard, so I'll use them as ground-planters, since they're sturdy and flat on the bottoms. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size and shape for a deck rail planter, holds plenty of soil for annuals to thrive. The coco fiber liner is a bit thin in places but not a problem since before filling with soil, I line the inside with lawn bags punctured here & there to retain moisture, reduce flow-thru draining, and to get a few extra seasons out of the liner. The customer comments regarding the rail clamp are correct, they don't fit my railing either but I just used heavy duty, wide, thick zip ties to attach it to the railing. BTW this item has increased in price $12-$13 since I purchased it. It is less on the seller's website.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Therapy

customer_reviews.title: Classy, functional
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, the installation bars did not fit on my railings. I ended up ordering a package of zip ties and using those to secure the planter to the railing. It was very easy to do but irritating that I had to buy another part. So far the planters I put up are attractive and sturdy and the herbs I planted in them seem healthy and happy. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Really nice railing planters
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these and they arrived as scheduled. Fit nice over our wood railing of 3 1//2" X 1 1/2". Nice and solid. Plenty of room for flowers. Really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Grandy

customer_reviews.title: Great planter for deck rails
customer_reviews.text: This planter came fully assembled, I only had to adjust the railing attachments and clip them on. My railings were a little too wide so I removed one of the wing nuts to widen the attachment. This made the railing holder a little wobbly and the planter wasn’t secured well enough to the railing, so I used 4 strong cable ties and secured the planter to the railings. I would have rated this product as 5 stars if the railing attachments had adjusted wider. In the past I purchased cheaper planters that came completely unassembled, they were very difficult to put together and still had to be secured with cable ties. I am very pleased with this planter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Way better than anything I can get locally!
customer_reviews.text: Quite solid construction and priced along the lines of crummy plastic junk I could get at Walmart. I didn't use the included mounting hardware, but rather used some stainless steel band straps to mount them at the top of my chain link fence. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: beholdragnarok

customer_reviews.title: It has been perfect for an herb garden - we have 5 herbs now on th in this, on porch railing.
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size for 5 herbs to fit in with space to grow. We did have to play with how it hung on the railing because our porch top has the skinny side of the board at the top and this holder is made more for something where a 2x4 or even 4x4 is the width at the top. We just grabbed some old hockey pucks to fill in the space so the hanging bracket can hang and it's hidden behind the basket so it all works well.
customer_reviews.author: H. Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartment balconies
customer_reviews.text: even if they are the skinny metal type rails. The hooks are tapped for a screw into metal railing. I did that. Stable and holds them beautifully. For the price, I feel like they were on point. And having the 48 inch size is unusual and most people purchase the tiny 24 or 32 inch for spaces that should have the large length to look right. In this case, more is more!
customer_reviews.author: DRW

customer_reviews.title: Loved its size but covered in red spider mites when delivered, OPEN OUTSIDE!
customer_reviews.text: Love the planters, they look great on my deck, one star taken away bc the box was delivered outside of course but it was COVERED in red spider mites, and I had to spray it before I even opened it, and thankfully I did open it outside, For some odd reason I did not bring this into my home, went straight from the front porch to the deck ( sprayed) Other than that, its nice. Now I know to be very very careful of anything being delivered again especially something from a garden department!
customer_reviews.author: fiddlestickchic

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: Product defective. I filled it with soil and hung it on my deck and today noticed that the metal was coming apart at the corner. I tried to reach costumer service but there is no way way to do this so I am posting this review in hopes that someone will followup on this. At $50 a piece they should hold up for more than a month
customer_reviews.author: marthas

customer_reviews.title: Handsome addition to the front of our house
customer_reviews.text: I love these windowbox planters! The resemble many that we saw on a spring visit to Charleston, SC. I purchased two of these to hang from our wrought iron porch railing, which is 2" wide. The included adjustable bracket, which comes in two sections, is primarily designed for wider deck railings. However, by using only the shorter bracket section in a manner for which it was not originally designed, I was able to hang the planters nicely on my 2" railing.
customer_reviews.author: Garry2Rs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well designed and beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two 4’ planters. These looked amazing on arrival out of the box. Sturdy build. Liners are the perfect thickness and design. Setup took maybe 10 minutes total for both to get them hung. Most of that was attributable to my inability to center on sight. The drainage is exactly what’s needed, and there was a LOT of room to plant my flowers in the planters. Very happy with this purchase and will buy new liners next year and reuse the planters.
customer_reviews.author: MBA

customer_reviews.title: Rail attachments don't work and Walmart's is half the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, but I almost immediately threw away the railing attachments because there way no way they'd work. They seem to be made for a particular type of railing, but I can't imagine it's one that is common. I bought cable ties (some call them zip ties) and those work great. HowEVER, but Walmart and Home Depot offer a product of the same size and quality for ~$14. If I had known that, I wouldn't have bought this $32 piece.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Adorable
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these. I mounted them using separately purchased stainless steel screws directly to the lower window molding. They are nice and light. I added some of the moisture retaining soil, to ensure the lightness, and water retention.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neville

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4 of these for herbs and small plants on my deck. Unfortunately, 3 out of the 4 that came in have broken tines on them (at least 3-4 of the flat iron panels) were broken. One of them had the entire corner disconnected. Though they look nice, and are easy to install, but the quality is severely lacking. In addition, the other reviews were correct, I had to add a few zip ties to help secure it to the deck, as the two brackets were not enough to keep the planter secured / safe. I would not buy again, and would like to return / refund the severely broken ones.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Scott

customer_reviews.title: The product is nice and quite sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice and quite sturdy... However in its description on Amazon is quite wrong! Single one or the four pack --- I bought both! Fist off its not 10" tall but rather 8.5".. Second it doesn't come with hardware to mount directly to the wall! As you see in my hand it only has rail hangers :( - which I didn't use because I muonted it directly to the outside of my rail! As you can see in the pictures - it looks quite nice on my railing! Great product so far...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and installed them under two windows. The installation was a breeze--just screw to the siding, no bracket needed--and they look fantastic! Good size to maintain plantings and excess water drains right out no matter how hard it rains. Feels nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: The Screaming Queen

customer_reviews.title: Bent brackets!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. I received this last week. My husband bolted it to the shingles, just below the window frame. I planted flowers and vines and it looked lovely. Withing 24 hours the brackets bent so the planter is tipped forward. Now it looks like its falling off the house.! I wanted a window box for the longest time. So sad this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a fence and used zip-ties instead of the provided hardware. These are beautiful and sturdy. The backs are flat and mounted flush to my fence. Shipping was fast and reliable. I have gotten so many compliments on my vertical garden!
customer_reviews.author: Rpapa

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, damaged and missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived as shown in the pictures, damaged and missing the brackets needed to actually hang it. I ordered two at the time (one had a single set of brackets, this one did not), so I guess it's 50/50 of you get the entire item as described. Expect it to be damaged though, no bubble wrap or packing paper was included in either shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I believe I bought 2 of the 30" baskets with liners. They're great, exactly what I expected. My rails however are only 1" sq so I couldn't use the brackets, so I used 3 zip ties and they're very secure. I put 3 plants in each and 6 single petunias to fill in. They hold allot! Note: I used a whole small bag of dirt to fill them. I underestimated just how much dirt they can hold. I was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Smith

customer_reviews.title: I must be one of the unlucky ones....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this May 2011 and it came with 2 adjustable hooks that were supposed to fit over the deck railing and slide into 2 sets of 2 'figure 8' holes (like a picture or wall clock on a nail). They didn't align. They didn't align by a lot... After 20 minutes cussing the Chinese Quality Control Inspector that let this slip by and banging with a hammer and pry bar they slipped in (never to be removed from the basket). It looks great, actually beautiful and LONG! I want two more but but wonder if the alignment will be better or worse. Only 3 stars because of alignment...
customer_reviews.author: Heartland IndianaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: this is a good, sturdy planter rack
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a good, sturdy planter rack. It has a nice finish and is made to hang over a railing wider than wrought iron. So I used zip ties to secure it to my narrow rails. It did not come with hardware, so you will have to provide you own anyway, so whatever your rail size, the zip ties may come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Minix

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed, but served the purpose
customer_reviews.text: These boxes are ok for my purposes. I like the look and size. The brackets are cheap - but I figured that out from the reviews prior to purchasing these. They did fit on my deck and held up through a storm with some gusty winds, but I don't trust them 100% yet. One of the welds for the box was detached, but I just ziptied that section for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: DBrady

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: Okay. This product is good because it works for patios that are concrete without a railing to hang a planter over. These will rest on the top of the wall with the hook holding them in place. Tgis product is not so good because one of them has already come apart at one of the back seams--the metal pieces of the frame have come unwelded. I was able to rig a fix, but at this price I had hoped they would not break within just a few months.
customer_reviews.author: A Mosley

customer_reviews.title: Great for new urban gardener
customer_reviews.text: Really nice planter. It is made for wood railing, such as a 2x4 piece of wood. So the bracket to mount it is larger. I was able to spin the bracket around backwards and make it work for a 1" metal railing. I would definitely recommend the quality. Just make sure it will fit your railing or prepare to get crafty to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: m.a.p.88

customer_reviews.title: VERY DECORATIVE AND LOOK GREAT
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted hanging planters so I looked on Amazon and found these...glad I did. She's very happy with them. Now we don't have a deck so I hung them on a window guard facing the driveway and they look great with the plants growing in them. The brackets are sort of wide for anything other than the top of a deck railing but with some hardware, sections of 2X4 and some DIY skill (not a whole lot, mind you) you'll get these planters up and level. If anyone out there needs some ideas on how to modify these units for whatever you want to hang them on, just post your inquiry on Amazon and I'll be glad to respond.
customer_reviews.author: fussmucker

customer_reviews.title: I've had these for a few years and they are still strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I just repainted mine with some black matte paint and they look like new again. Definitely help make my deck look more attractive. They are large enough to hold quite a few flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Monroe

customer_reviews.title: love this planter
customer_reviews.text: love these planters. they were as described. packaged so as not to be damaged and while my railings also are thin, i used floral wire to secure them and it works great. i am very pleased. inam ordering 10 cocoa liners as 30 inch is not a size carried everywhere? found lots of 24 and 36 liners but not 30. stock up!!!!😀
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Decent function, minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This functions as expected. Is classy and contains plants! Minor observations include: 1) If your deck railing is thin, you may need to put in a piece of wood to buffer the brackets as they don't get very thin (especially vertically), 2) Birds will come sit near this and tend to enjoy picking away at and (I guess) eating the straw basket, and 3) If you live on a 2nd story or higher and have people living below you, they may experience some water trickle runoff after watering - as the straw basket is obviously porous. Overall, I'm satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: Works great with small modification
customer_reviews.text: These planters really have worked well. They are sturdy and the adjustable clamp fits well over my wide deck railings. I think that if someone had a very narrow railing it might be a problem though. The one modification we made was to wedge some wood (a piece of a tree branch would do) under the edge of the deck railing where the clamp connects. This helped the unit to sit more horizontally without pitching forward and also helped distribute the weight better.
customer_reviews.author: DDCTop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Solution for Herbs
customer_reviews.text: I Love these - for how they look, diimensions and great value. I bought 3 of them! What an attractive solution for planting my herbs! I planted each herb in a separate pot (I used 7" Smart Pots - also from Amazon - which are soft and flexible) and even included some colorful coleus mixed it. I was able to fit 4 Smart Pots in each windowbox . They look fabulous lined up against my stone patio wall and the plants are doing GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: rosy1111

customer_reviews.title: Check your order...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered four of the window box planters. Two each were put in two big cardboard boxes with no padding of any kind, so they have wear marks from the shipping process. One window box of the four came with no brackets attached, so, I guess I’m SOL. Tried to contact the company, but they seem to be well insulated from any complaint or action to help. Buyer beware with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Davis

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased. I'll be getting more!
customer_reviews.text: These are big enough to plant my geraniums and greens to accent them. The flowers really thrive. The planters are large and sturdy and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Adorable!
customer_reviews.text: Really love these planters! We bolted them onto the window seal and they turned out amazing! On came slightly bent but we did our best to shape it again, not perfect but not really noticeable so we left it. We loved them so much that we just repurchased for our next project!
customer_reviews.author: Krotter

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I know I ordered a 36-inch and they sent me a 48-inch. I went back and looked and it said I ordered 48 in which I know I did not. But I guess I'll make it work I have no way to exchange butits beautiful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DIY modifications make these work well.
customer_reviews.text: Attractive. Needed to make adjustments: 1. used piece of 2x4 behind basket to shim from plastic bannister uprights. Otherwise brackets did not hold sufficiently from tipping forward & dropping off thin top rail. 2. Basket linings thin, collapsed inward covering new plant seedling. Solved wirh Interwoven fishing line in metal framework retracting the material. Have 6 now and satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Suez 0

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, sturdy, easy to set onto deck rail !
customer_reviews.text: Love these planters. They are black, painted metal. The coco liner comes with them. They set up easily and they look great. I saw the same ones as window/deck boxes at store fronts and outside restaurant rails on Newberry St in Boston, MA. They are just as pictured and will be used yearly. I have planted herbs in mine and they are doing great ! The price is perfect for something that looks more expensive. Would definitely purchase these again and from the same seller. Packages came on time and packaged perfectly with all needed hardware and instructions ( although no instructions were really necessary. Sort of self explanatory for attaching to a deck rail as shown). Don't hesitate !
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Product needs strengthening
customer_reviews.text: Although I liked the pricing and initial quality of this product a heavy snow has caused all of mine to bend outward irreparably. Stronger construction would have averted this. Lasted less than two years and no contact from seller to replace since posting this. $120 wasted...
customer_reviews.author: Greg Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these planters. I hang them from the bottom of the rail on the above ground deck allowing for a great punch of color without affecting the view. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: They're well made and look beautiful hanging on my privacy fence - although in another week or so, the flowers will hide them completely. They came with heavy-duty hangers for a porch rail, but I couldn't use those on the fence. This made them slightly harder to hang, but I'm glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: SueC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful planters!
customer_reviews.text: The planters are great. We had no quality issues at all. Only problem was the rail holders were way too think for our rail. We took suggestions of others and used ties and they worked perfectly. They hold lots of plants and look great!
customer_reviews.author: Sockster

customer_reviews.title: Good planter, horrible mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: The planter itself appears to be very good. The problem is the brackets, the only way to use the supplied wingnuts that came with mine would be to drill into my deck railing, which isn't happening. The bottom bracket really should have a bolt/post on it and then a wing nut to tighten the two pieces together. Instead the wing nut is permanently attached to the bolt and there is no way to use the wing nut because you need space under the brackets, yet these are over railing mounts. Luckily I have enough hardware around I was able to use bolts and nuts, but not 100% happy with the setup.
customer_reviews.author: alg

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately didn't work with our wall.
customer_reviews.text: Overall bummed out with this product. It wasn't able to be installed on our block wall as we had hoped it would. Our fault, it took us past the 30 days to request a return. I would have thought that due to covid, this would be understandable and some leeway made, but that was not the case. Now we have 2 planters we cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Selna

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: This top metal bar and the horizontal bar directly below it are not even with each other, poor manufacturing quality control. That being said, I decided to keep it because 1) It would be too much hassle to ship it back, 2) Once my flowers grow a bit more, it won't be noticeable, 3) Everything else about it was as advertised 4) It was a great price for this size fence planter. If I need another, I'll probably take a chance and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pam L

customer_reviews.title: Five stars!!! Amazing quality...
customer_reviews.text: Update: AMAZING quality. I am looking into buying planters for our new front deck. I searched my Amazon orders, because I love the 3 planters I have on our back deck. Anyway, I found out I purchased these 3 planters in 2013!!! And they are still amazing. They stay outside all year round (we live in a ski area). Each summer I buy new liners and make it look good again with beautiful flowers and plants... Buy these planters, they won’t disappoint 😋 Looks beautiful. Even after an entire year still in great shape!!! Just bought new coconut liners at Lowes...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these just to see how it looked and how it would work on my porch rail. It's wood and is 3 1/2 inches wide, and it fit perfectly. It looks beautiful, it was extremely easy to assemble (just a matter of screwing wing nuts into the brackets to adjust the size), and I'm going to order three more to go along the entire railing. It feels very sturdy and it's nice and deep. If you have the right kind of rail or wall, this would be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: EALowe

customer_reviews.title: Measure your deck railing before purchasing. The clamping system ...
customer_reviews.text: Measure your deck railing before purchasing. The clamping system is for a thin top rail. I purchased three and one was damaged. The mounting piece that is supposed to be attached to the planter was broken off. Found in bottom of box.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey P.

customer_reviews.title: Brackets may not work & no "help" or "assistance" provided by company
customer_reviews.text: Potted meshing & cradle are good thus far, but mounting brackets provided were very disappointing. If you have cast-iron railings this cannot be mounted with brackets provided. More aggravating is that no "help" or "assistance" contact is provided. In fact, I could not locate company on the web (presumably "Panacea"). Relied on advice given to by another customer (thank you!) with the same dilemma & used strong zip-ties that seem to handle the weight of pot with soil.
customer_reviews.author: C. Donald

customer_reviews.title: but we couldn't find a good alternative. Quality-wise it is well-made
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit pricey, but we couldn't find a good alternative. Quality-wise it is well-made. As others have pointed out, the brackets only help with installation on a very specific type of railing. I didn't use them at all, but just hung the basket directly on screws installed on the railing verticals below the top.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love so much
customer_reviews.text: Love so much! I'll be buying another for my balcony :) I had no trouble fitting the brackets over my railing. The 3-4in width is perfect. My issue is that it only hooks around to grasp a small cusp on my railing. It's pretty sturdy and I've had it up for a few weeks now with no problem, but I think I'm going to buy zipties just for added security. This comes with the liner, btw! I bought one separately, so now I have two.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love this planter. It is a beautiful addition to our home. It is just what we were looking for and the price and quality can`t be beat. We are so pleased with it that we bought two more.
customer_reviews.author: texas

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Really well made window box and it's the perfect size for most large bay windows. I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for a affordable and quality window box.
customer_reviews.author: jessk55

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Growing fabulous herbs off my deck! Saw this off a deck of a fancy restaurant. Ordered one as a gift and one for me. We both love these! Brackets fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a couple of years. It has held up very well. I am pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied but thin liner.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied, my only complaint is that the coco liner is pretty thin so much that it almost has soil leaking due to holes. The frame is very durable, I have another that I have used 3 years only replacing the liner each year. I bought 3 more this year.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the product I was hoping it would be. Well made and attractive, including the coco liner; and exactly the right size for the lattice screen I affixed it to. Couldn't use the brackets that came with it which are designed for the type of fence shown in the picture. I affixed it to my lattice screen from the back with two 1/2" wide cable ties, which are strong, took only a minute to do, are unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: BLUESMANJACK

customer_reviews.title: Supplied brackets are lousy.
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, the brackets are flimsy and will need modification for a sturdy install.
customer_reviews.author: DBS

customer_reviews.title: It is flimsy and poorly welded. I would NEVER buy another one.
customer_reviews.text: Attractive. To small. Very flimsy. It fell apart while I was hanging it. It is welded poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Steinbrecher

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Good quality and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: William Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes them (we bought 2), so that's the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife likes them (we bought 2), so that's the main thing. I was unable to use the hardware due to the location of the spindles on my deck, but just drilled some holes and used my own screws, and had both solidly attached in about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: RoginOhio

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product ! Lined it with black plastic ,planted it ,plants are growing like weeds.It looks very pretty!!It was very easy to install just two screws to hang it under my window on the wall.I am very pleased will buy another couple.love it !!
customer_reviews.author: Firefly

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart when it arrived, brackets too wide to adequately secure it to rail.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a sharp piece of metal detaching from the base. Didn't want to wait out the return so will probably try to glue it somehow. Also, brackets are extremely wide and, as we are using this on a 1.5 in rail, will require zip ties or some other means of securing it. Overall not thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: chelsey casey

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install directly into brick under an upstairs window. Has a beautiful appearance that actually looks better in person than in the photo. Seems to be of solid construction (not bullet proof but sturdy). Back has typical "key hole" slots so pretty straight forward install. Installed about a year ago and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bentley Robinette

customer_reviews.title: Why are two of the same things different
customer_reviews.text: Ordered before and they were fine. Ordered two More. One bent and other had some Weird fiber basket completely unlike the baskets that came with other three. Not a big enough deal to bother to replace but annoying
customer_reviews.author: jeff w gilles

customer_reviews.title: I'm doing fine.  Really.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my ex-wife on Mothers Day. Really. Along with a few Creeping Jenny plants. Creeping, not Creepy. Anyway, it looks great on the porch rail of her new house. I miss my dog.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Panacea Products Flat Iron Series 30 Inch Window Deck Planter
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Quality, has the Coconut husk for keeping the plant in place. Excellent back for hanging even heavy plants with the dirt. The planter is nice and deep too so your plant will stabilize well in it. It will be really nice to use. Worth the money too, I thought it was a bit high at first, but not at all. It is a must to see to really know that it is worth what your paying. It isn't a cheap ole thing you get at a Garden Center. Glad I Bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: very well made
customer_reviews.text: I fitted the planter to fit into the top of a half-moon wrought iron table, plated flowers and used outside on patio
customer_reviews.author: bestshopper67

customer_reviews.title: Five star rating - would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely pleased - looks beautiful - good value and workmanship!
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Great planter, super happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this planter. It's very sturdy and well made and the planting liner has held up beautifully in the wind and rain. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love these planters!
customer_reviews.text: In May I purchased four of these planters. They are fabulous. They look substantial, have the cocoa liners, and two kinds of mounting brackets, so they can be mounted on a window sill or on a porch rail. I also bought 3 of the hanging baskets. They, too, are sturdy & well made. Everything is powder-coated steel that has the look of wrought-iron. I saw no places that weren't finished. I have seen both these items at Grandin Road for much more than on Amazon. Can't tell you the compliments I've had. Even empty they look good, though much nicer with flowers.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Shellhase

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived very quickly and was well packaged so that none of the baskets were scratched when I got them (i ordered 4). They were very easy to assemble and mount. The only problem I had with the brackets was that they wouldn't grab onto the ledge facing outwards off the deck, so I had to hang them inwards inside the deck. This was because there wasn't enough overhang on my deck railing and not any fault of the product. They look beautiful and are making wonderful herb planters.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barone

customer_reviews.title: Size and sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: Like size. Able to plant flowers and vines that block view thru our fence.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Screwed these directly into my brick wall with a required secondary purchase of brick anchors and extra screws. Seem to be holding up well and look high-quality (even though they're a little more flexible than I'd prefer).
customer_reviews.author: Anna Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: great products. Beautiful and easy to hang with adjustable ...
customer_reviews.text: These can hold a surprising amount of weight! No rust, great products. Beautiful and easy to hang with adjustable features for various railing sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Good

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Only sad it didn't fit on our rail just right. So we enforced with zip ties. Still looks beautiful from curb!
customer_reviews.author: Beth McCrary

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Product comes with mounting hardware for a deck rail. However, I wanted this mounted below a window. Quick purchase for concrete anchors and mounting was a breeze. Only wish the coconut fiber was thicker. Otherwise, this is a five star product!
customer_reviews.author: Jo H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my balcony!  Sturdy and pretty.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these on 2 separate occasions and unfortunately, the bolting mechanism do not match on them - so I recommend buying multiple at once if you choose to have more than 1. Other than that, the product itself is pretty and has supported my succulents well.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my wife on Christmas and she really likes it. The one thing I didn’t expect with this is the size of the basket. It’s not bad, but it is a lot wider than what the pictures make it look like, so you can put more flowers or herbs in there. The attachments to the railing are simple if you have a screwdriver or power tool, it’ll probably take you 10 minutes at most.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: wonderful planters.
customer_reviews.text: bought 2...attached to my porch railing..planted strawberry plants in them..wonderful planters..perfect size..easy to tend..easy to set up and use..very pleased with purchase...look very nice and atttractive filled with green plants..can hardly wait for the harvest!!
customer_reviews.author: czspots

customer_reviews.title: looks good, hangers were not suitable for my house but ...
customer_reviews.text: Works, looks good, hangers were not suitable for my house but was able to make do without.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Really loved the 2 planters that I purchased. They were great for 2 years. Now however, the black plastic that covers the metal is pealing off.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Look great. Wanted flower boxes for second floor balcony rental apartment with 3 1/2” railings. Read previous reviews and prepared for hardware not working on slanted railing. Used heavy duty plastic ties. Worked well - not too heavy - hasn’t budged and they look great!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well made - my wife and I are enjoying it on our patio very much.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted, but....
customer_reviews.text: These planters were exactly what I was looking for for on my back deck. I have used them now for two summers. When they arrived (I bought three), one of the planters was missing one of the braces that attaches it to the rail of my deck. So, I called customer service and they sent one to me with little trouble. My only other complaint is that after one summer on my deck, the braces started to rust. This summer, I'm going to spray paint them with Rustoleum and see if that helps. That's why I gave them only 4 stars. They are very pretty planters and really look nice on my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect planters
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and attractive. They feel sturdy and I read the comments about how they do not attach well, and did not find that to be the case at all. The brackets are adjustable and attached perfectly and snugly. These planters are securely attached and are not going to fall. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ExploreSF

customer_reviews.title: Planter is great, unfortunately there's too much Louisiana sun in that ...
customer_reviews.text: I hung it on our fence following the alternate hanging directions another poster mentioned. Planter is great, unfortunately there's too much Louisiana sun in that location for my herbs. Not the planter's fault, I'll find something pretty to put in there soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nolarachel

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: I have a deck, and this planter is perfect for my use. Since its fall, I decided to plant some spinach in it. Its just wide enough to support my spinach plants. It also looks GREAT. I will certainly buy another when spring comes around to plant pretty flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Vanita

customer_reviews.title: The company was amazing and it was easy to return and get a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this once and returned it because it was missing brackets. The company was amazing and it was easy to return and get a second one. The trough is industrial strength and easy to set up. Appreciate the high quality of materials.
customer_reviews.author: MAG

customer_reviews.title: These were the perfect size for our front porch
customer_reviews.text: These were the perfect size for our front porch.Our front porch rails bow out a little bit, and these sit nicely on them and don't budge. They look great, too.
customer_reviews.author: CorgiLover

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful window box!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my front porch railing to prevent bikers from attaching their bikes. It is super cute and works great for me! The railing is very thin, so I did not attempt to use the attachments. Instead, I purchased some zip ties and attached it with those. They worked great and it is sturdy and supported.
customer_reviews.author: dsbj

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We followed the advice of using zip ties and im pleased with how nice the planters look and my plants are growing beautifully on my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Zenia

customer_reviews.title: These are sturdy and a beautiful accent to our balcony
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and a beautiful accent to our balcony. At the advice of other reviewers I secured them to the railing using 5 black zip ties. The hooks were way too big for my thinner railings.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

product_meta.title: Panacea Products Flat Iron Series 30-inch (30") Window/Deck Planter, Black
product_meta.description: Size:30 inchThis wall hanger has flattened metal bars which make up the entire motif of the product & give the basket a very classic, sturdy look & feel. The included coco liner prevents soil from spilling out, & the large 29" long planting area offers plenty of room for flowers & vines. Included is mounting hardware which allows for easy installation.
feature_bullets: Flat iron Series window and deck planter
Measures 8-inches in width by 30-inches in length by 7.8-Inches in Height

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars493 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
